messages.name: IMC
messages.author: Ricardo Martins, Paulo Sousa Dias, Eduardo Marques, José Pinto
messages.description:
This document describes the communications protocol associated with the USTL software framework. Concepts such as message, field and packet are explained in detail in the subsequent chapters.

Inter module communication is achieved by the exchange of messages that can be recognized and interpreted by all participating modules. A message is a self-contained collection of data fields conveying relevant information about a given subject. The mean by which the messages are exchanged is not described in this document, but the reader can assume that at least the UDP Internet protocol is available at all ends of the communications channel.

The Neptus Command and Control Unit (CCU), currently being used at USTL, supports mission planning and control, using the described messaging API. This software entity can be used to plan a mission before execution and monitor the mission's execution by presenting an operating console. For further details on this software contact the USTL.

A CCU exercises authority over a vehicle (real or simulated). Usually this term is applied to software in the class of USTL Neptus, but can also be applied to software modules extending the vehicle core control software.

The USTL reserves itself the right to use message identification numbers up to 1999. Thus if a 3rd party needs to extend this API it must use identification numbers starting at 2000. The identification number 65535 has a special meaning and must not be used to extend the IMC protocol.

types.description: Messages and packets can be viewed as a finite collection of fields. The list of valid field types is presented below.

type.name: fp32_t
type.description: 32 bit single precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

type.name: fp64_t
type.description: 64 bit double precision floating point number in IEEE 754 format.

type.name: message
type.description: An inline message. Useful for encapsulating other messages.

serialization.description: To ensure accurate transportation some field types may require special treatment on transmission and reception. The operation of preparing a field type for transmission is called serialization, the inverse action is called deserialization. No special serialization is required for types that are not described in the table below, their values should be used as is.

type.name: rawdata
type.description: A sequence of type rawdata is serialized by prepending a value of type uint16_t, representing the length of the sequence, to the stream of bytes. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct size of data bytes. The rawdata type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: plaintext
type.description: A sequence of type plaintext is serialized by prepending a value of type uint16_t, representing the length of the sequence, to the stream of ASCII characters. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct ASCII character sequence size. The plaintext type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

type.name: message
type.description: A field of type message is serialized by prepending a value of type uint16_t, representing the identification number of the message, to the serialized message payload. The special identification number 65535 must be used when no message is present. On deserialization the prepended value is used to retrieve the correct message identification number. The message type length is limited only by the communication protocol in use.

units.description: The following table lists the units used in the subsequent chapters.

unit.name: List of key/value tuples
unit.description: This unit is a list of label/value tuples and is only valid in plaintext fields. The label and value portions of a tuple are separated using the equal sign (=) and tuples are separated using the semicolon character (;). These delimiting characters must not be used elsewhere. Leading and trailing semicolons must be removed. Examples: "label1=12;label2=3" or "label1=12" or "label1=test_2".

header.description: The packet header contains handling information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the beginning of a packet.

field.name: Synchronization Number
field.description:
The synchronization number marks the beginning of a packet. It denotes the packet API version and can be used to deduce the byte order of the sending host.
The packet recipient is responsible for the correct interpretation of the synchronization number and byte order conversions.

field.name: Message Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the message contained in the packet. This field is used for correct message interpretation and deserialization.

field.name: Message size
field.description: The size of the message data in the packet. The maximum allowed value is 65535.

field.name: Time stamp
field.note: Correct interpretation of this field may require synchronization of clocks between sender and recipient
field.description: The time when the packet was sent, as seen by the packet dispatcher. The number of seconds is represented in Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) in seconds since Jan 1, 1970 using IEEE double precision floating point numbers.

field.name: Source Address
field.description: The Source IMC system ID.

field.name: Destination Address
field.description: The Destination IMC system ID.

footer.description: The packet footer contains validation information in the form of supplemental fields, it is always placed at the end of a packet.

field.name: Check Sum (CRC-16-IBM)
field.description: The check sum field is computed using the CRC-16-IBM with polynomial 0x8005 (x^16 + x^15 + x^2 + 1). The data contributing for the CRC includes all preceding header and message bytes.

message.name: Heartbeat
message.description: The Heartbeat message is used to inform other modules that the sending entity's system is running normally and communications are alive.

message.name: Abort
message.description: Stops the mission and put the system in a stand by mode.

field.name: Source
field.description: The source of the abort request

message.name: Joystick
message.description:
Message normally used for teleoperation (unconstrained maneuver). This message transmits the state of one (identified) joystick. The next field descriptions are made for a standard joystick but this message can be used by different devices, mapping the message fields differently.

Figure 2 - Joystick axis

field.name: Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the joystick that has generated the message.

field.name: Axis 0 x
field.description: State of the main "directional analogic button" in the horizontal axis. The values are between -1 (total left) and 1 (total right).

field.name: Axis 0 y
field.description: State of the main "directional analogic button" in the vertical axis. The values are between -1 (total down) and 1 (total up).

field.name: Axis 1 x
field.description: State of the secondary "directional analogic button" in the horizontal axis. The values are between -1 (total left) and 1 (total right).

field.name: Axis 1 y
field.description: State of the secondary "directional analogic button" in the vertical axis. The values are between -1 (total down) and 1 (total up).

field.name: Axis 2 Angle
field.description: State of the "digital directional button". If not pressed the value is -1. If pressed the field gives the direction of the button in radians (between 0 and 2PI).

field.name: Analog Command
field.description: State of the "analogic button". The values are between -1 (none power) and 1 (total power), 0 is the middle.

field.name: Pressed Buttons
field.description: Each bit of this field represents a button, so we can have up to 32. The less significant bit represents the button 1 (0x00000001 == button 1 pressed).

message.name: Estimated State
message.description:
This message presents the state of the vehicle. Depending on the Reference Mode value the position may be given as one of the following:
  • A single absolute Lat/Lon/Depth point
  • North/East/Down offsets from the vehicle's current reference point
  • Both fields, being the offsets computed using the Lat/Lon/Depth sent as the reference point

The body-fixed reference frame and Euler angles are depicted next:

Figure 3 - Euler angles

field.name: Reference Mode
field.description: Reference Mode field indicates which position related fields have meaningful values.

enum.name: NED only
enum.description: Only fields x, y, z have meaningful values. The absolute location is computed using the vehicle's home reference point.

enum.name: Lat/Lon/Depth only
enum.description: Only fields lat, lon, depth have meaningful values. The x, y and z fields are ignored independently of their values.

enum.name: NED and Lat/Lon/Depth
enum.description: Fields x, y, z, lat, lon, depth have meaningful values. The final location is computed as a NED offset translation from the Lat/Lon/Depth point.

field.name: Offset north (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down field. If Reference Mode states that this field is not used the value must be ignored.

field.name: Offset east (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down field. If Reference Mode states that this field is not used the value must be ignored.

field.name: Offset down (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down field. If Reference Mode states that this field is not used the value must be ignored.

field.name: Rotation over x axis
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over y axis
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over z axis
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Body-Fixed xx Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed yy Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed zz Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame zz axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity X (North)
field.description: Ground Velocity xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity Y (East)
field.description: Ground Velocity yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity Z (Down)
field.description: Ground Velocity zz axis velocity component.

field.name: Angular Velocity in x
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed xx axis (roll rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in y
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed yy axis (pitch rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in z
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis (yaw rate).

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude.

field.name: Depth (m)
field.description: WGS-84 Depth.

message.name: Event
message.description: An event reported by a vehicle subsystem.

field.name: Source
field.description: The source subsystem for the event

field.name: Event Type
field.description: The type of event

field.name: Device Id
field.description: Identification number of the originating device

field.name: Event description
field.description: An additional event description that will be logged

message.name: Simulated Position
message.description: This message presents the simulated position of the vehicle.

field.name: Offset north (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset east (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset down (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down field.

message.name: CPU Usage
message.description: Report of software CPU usage.

field.name: Usage Percentage
field.description: The CPU usage, in percentage, of the sending software.

message.name: Storage Usage
message.description: Report of storage usage.

field.name: Available
field.description: The available storage in bytes of the reporting device.

field.name: Usage
field.description: The percentage of storage used by the reporting device.

message.name: Cache Control
message.description: Control message caching to persistent storage.

field.name: Control Operation
field.description: Operation

field.name: Snapshot destination
field.description: Destination for the cache snapshot file.

field.name: Message
field.description: Message to store.

message.name: Logging Control
message.description: Control message logging to persistent storage.

field.name: Control Operation
field.description: Control Operation

enum.name: Request Start of Logging
enum.description: Request the logging manager to start logging. The logging manager will reply with a STARTED operation. If logging is already in progress the current log will be closed and a new one will be opened (therefore the logging manager will send two messages - STOPPED and STARTED). The field 'name' represents the label that will be appended to the log path.

enum.name: Logging Started
enum.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation everytime a log is successfully started. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log.

enum.name: Request Logging Stop
enum.description: Request the logging manager to stop logging messages. The logging manager will reply with a STOPPED operation and logging will be suspended until a message with operation START is received. If logging is already stoppped the logging manager will ignore this operation and will not reply with a STOPPED operation. The field 'name' with this operation type has no meaning.

enum.name: Logging Stopped
enum.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation when logging is successfully stopped. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log that was closed.

enum.name: Request Current Log Name
enum.description: This operation instructs the logging manager to send a message with operation CURRENT_NAME containing the complete name of the current log in the field 'name'. The field 'name' with this operation type has no meaning.

enum.name: Current Log Name
enum.description: The logging manager will send a message with this operation when asked via the REQUEST_CURRENT_NAME operation. The field 'name' contains the complete name of the log.

field.name: Log Label / Path
field.description: The meaning of this field depends on the operation and is explained in the operation's description.

message.name: Request Entity Information
message.description: This message requests information about an entity. It is useful to resolve device ids.

field.name: Entity Id
field.description: Id of the entity.

message.name: Entity Information
message.description: This message describes and entity.

field.name: Entity Id
field.description: Entity id.

field.name: Label
field.description: Entity label or empty if the entity id is not valid.

message.name: System Aliases
message.description: This message describes the names of all field ids in the system

field.name: aliases
field.description: Example: "battery=11,ctd=3"

message.name: Ignition
message.description:
Ignition request was detected or received.

In the context of autonomous maneuver execution, if the vehicle is set up for it, an ignition triggers the execution of the mission previously loaded onto memory or restored from the on-board file system.

An ignition may induced by an human (through manual propeller movement or CCU GUI interface) or by a Mission Supervisor module.

field.name: Source
field.description: The source of the ignition request

message.name: Acknowlegement
message.description: This message confirms the reception of message with a given sequence id

field.name: Sequence Id
field.description: The sequence id of the message that is being confirmed

message.name: Envelope
message.description: This message wraps another message extending the current protocol

field.name: Sequence Id
field.description: The sequence id of the message.

field.name: Flags
field.description: This message is to be acknowledged by the receiver

message.name: Rotations Per Minute
message.description: Number of rotations per minute.

field.name: Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Value
field.description: Number of rotations per minute.

message.name: Internal Temperature
message.description: Report of internal temperature.

field.name: Sensor Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting internal temperature sensor.

field.name: Measured Temperature Value
field.description: The value of the internal temperature as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Internal Voltage
message.description: Report of internal electrical voltage.

field.name: Sensor Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting internal electrical voltage sensor.

field.name: Measured Voltage Value
field.description: The value of the internal electrical voltage as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Internal Current
message.description: Report of internal electrical current.

field.name: Sensor Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting internal electrical current sensor.

field.name: Measured Current Value
field.description: The value of the internal electrical current as measured by the sensor.

message.name: GPS Fix
message.description: Report of a GPS fix.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting GPS device.

field.name: UTC Time of Fix
field.description: UTC time of the GPS fix measured in seconds since 00:00:00 (midnight).

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude coordinate.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude coordinate.

field.name: Fix Quality
field.description: Quality of the GPS fix.

enum.name: Invalid Fix
enum.description: The GPS fix is not valid.

field.name: Number of Satellites
field.description: Number of satellites viewed by the GPS device at the time of the fix.

field.name: Horizontal Dilution
field.description: Horizontal dilution of position.

field.name: Altitude
field.description: Altitude above mean sea level.

field.name: Device Identification
field.description: Identification of the reporting device.

field.name: UTC Time of Fix
field.description: UTC time of the rejected GPS fix measured in seconds since 00:00:00 (midnight).

field.name: Reason
field.description: Reason for rejection

message.name: GPS Fix (RINEX)
message.description: This message contains all information needed to be able to generate a RINEX file.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Satellite Number
field.description: Satellite Number.

field.name: Time of Week
field.description: Measurement integer millisecond GPS time of week (Receiver Time).

field.name: Week
field.description: Measurement GPS week number (Receiver Time).

field.name: Carrier phase measurement
field.description: Carrier phase measurement (L1 cycles).

field.name: Pseudorange measurement
field.description: Pseudorange measurement.

field.name: Doppler measurement
field.description: Doppler measurement.

field.name: Space Vehicle Number
field.description: Space Vehicle Number.

field.name: Navigation Measurements Quality Indicator
field.description: Navigation Measurements Quality Indicator.

field.name: Signal Strength
field.description: Signal Strength.

field.name: Loss of lock indicator
field.description: Loss of lock indicator.

message.name: Euler Angles
message.description: Report of spatial orientation.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Device Time
field.description: The device time.

field.name: Roll
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle longitudinal axis.

field.name: Pitch
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle lateral or transverse axis.

field.name: Yaw (True)
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle vertical axis. A value of 0 means the vehicle is oriented towards true north. In cases where the sensor cannot measure the true heading, this field will have the same value as Yaw (Magnetic).

field.name: Yaw (Magnetic)
field.description: Rotation around the vehicle vertical axis. A value of 0 means the vehicle is oriented towards magnetic north. In cases where the sensor cannot measure the magnetic heading, this field will have the same value as Yaw (True).

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Device Time
field.description: The device time.

field.name: Roll
field.description: Roll component.

field.name: Pitch
field.description: Pitch component.

field.name: Yaw
field.description: Yaw component.

message.name: Acceleration
message.description: Vector quantifying the direction and magnitude of the measured acceleration that a device is exposed to.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Device Time
field.description: The device time.

field.name: X
field.description: X component.

field.name: Y
field.description: Y component.

field.name: Z
field.description: Z component.

message.name: LBL Range
message.description: When the vehicle uses Long Base Line navigation, this message notifies that a new range was received from one of the acoustics transponders. The message fields are used to identify the range value and the transponder name.

field.name: Beacon Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the acoustic transponder from which the range information was received.

field.name: Range
field.description: Distance to the acoustic transponder.

field.name: Beacon Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the acoustic transponder from which the range information was received.

field.name: Range
field.description: Distance to the acoustic transponder.

field.name: Reason
field.description: Reason for rejection

message.name: LBL Detection
message.description: Report of an LBL detection.

field.name: Transmission
field.description: True for transmission detections

field.name: Channel
field.description: Channel

field.name: Timer
field.description: Internal Timer Value

message.name: LBL Beacon Setup
message.description: Set the acoustic beacon position.

field.name: Beacon Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the acoustic transponder from which the position information will be sent.

field.name: Beacon Name
field.description: Name of the acoustic transponder from which the position information will be sent.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude coordinate.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude coordinate.

field.name: Depth
field.description: The beacon's depth.

field.name: Interrogation channel
field.description: Interrogation frequency.

field.name: Reply channel
field.description: Reply frequency.

field.name: Transponder delay
field.description: Transponder delay.

message.name: Ground Velocity
message.description: Vehicle velocity relative to the ground.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Validity
field.description: Validity of the measurement

field.name: X
field.description: X component.

field.name: Y
field.description: Y component.

field.name: Z
field.description: Z component.

message.name: Water Velocity
message.description: Water velocity.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Validity
field.description: Validity of the measurement

field.name: X
field.description: X component.

field.name: Y
field.description: Y component.

field.name: Z
field.description: Z component.

message.name: Bottom Range
message.description: Range to the bottom.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: X
field.description: X component.

field.name: Y
field.description: Y component.

field.name: Z
field.description: Z component.

message.name: Temperature
message.description: Report of temperature.

field.name: Sensor Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Temperature
field.description: The value of the temperature as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Pressure
message.description: Report of external pressure.

field.name: Sensor Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Measured Pressure
field.description: The value of the pressure as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Conductivity
message.description: Report of conductivity.

field.name: Sensor Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Conductivity
field.description: The value of the conductivity as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Salinity
message.description: Report of salinity.

field.name: Sensor Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

field.name: Measured Salinity
field.description: The value of the salinity as measured by the sensor.

message.name: Request Imagenex Sonar Config
message.description: A message requesting for the actual config of an imagenex sonar.

message.name: Imagenex Sonar Config
message.description: Parameter values for configuring a Sonar Head manufactured by Imagenex.

field.name: Additional Time To Wait Between Steps
field.description: Additional time to wait between two steps. Use this field for speed control instead of Switch Delay. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Head ID
field.description: A value allowing multiple sonar heads to operate at the same time. When operating multiple sonar heads, a unique ID can be assigned to each device. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Range
field.description: The scanning range of the sonar head. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Rotation Mode
field.description: Starts or stops the rotation of the sonar head. Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Start Gain
field.description: The Start Gain. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: LOGF
field.description: I am not familiar enough with sonar theory to know what is this parameter good for. If you know what is LOGF than please update this description. The resolution of this parameter is 10dB, so only four values are possible: 10, 20, 30 and 40dB. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Absorption
field.description: The absorption of the scanning sound in the liquid where the sonar is. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Train Angle
field.description: The offset of the scanning window in profile mode. Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Sector Width
field.description: The width of the profile window in profile mode. Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Step Size
field.description: Step size (rotation of the head between two steps). Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Pulse Length
field.description: The length (in time) of the scanning pulse. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Profile Minimum Range
field.description: Minimum range for profile point digitization. Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Number Of Data Points
field.description: Number of the echo points in return data. Only two values are possible: 250 and 500. Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Data Bits Per Point
field.description: Number of the data bits per each echo point in return data. Only three values are possible: 4, 8 and 16. Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Operation Mode
field.description: Sonar operation mode

enum.name: Normal
enum.description: Normal operation - rotating continuously. Supported models: 881a, 852.

enum.name: Change rotation direction
enum.description: Changes the direction of the rotation. Supported models: 881a.

enum.name: Calibration
enum.description: Turns on the calibration mode (what will calibrate the sonar head). Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Switch Delay
field.description: The head will wait this amount of time before sending its return data. 0 = fastest operation, 0.51 = slowest operation. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Frequency
field.description: The frequency of the scanning sound. Supported models: 881a, 852.

message.name: Imagenex Sonar Return Data
message.description: The result of a scan with an Imagenex sonar.

field.name: Angle
field.description: The position of the sonar head. Supported models: 881a.

field.name: Number Of Echo Points
field.description: The resolution of the scan. Can be 0, 250 and 500. Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Bits Per Point
field.description: The "color" depth of the scan (how many bits are belonging to one echo point). Supported models: 881a, 852.

field.name: Echo Points
field.description: The echo data. The first point is the nearest to the head and the last one is the farthest. Supported models: 881a, 852.

message.name: Wind Speed
message.description: Measurement of wind speed.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

message.name: Relative Humidity
message.description: Measurement of relative humidity.

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: The identification number of the reporting device.

message.name: Device Data (Text)
message.description: Verbatim representation of device data in plain text format

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the source device

field.name: Value
field.description: Plain text data as extracted directly from the device

message.name: Device Data (Binary)
message.description: Verbatim representation of device data in binary format

field.name: Device Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the source device

field.name: Value
field.description: Raw binary data as extracted directly from the device

message.name: Actuate Relay
message.description: Actuates the relay system.

field.name: Number
field.description: Relay identification number.

field.name: Action
field.description: Action to perform.

message.name: Set Thruster Actuation
message.description: Actuate directly on a thruster.

field.name: Thruster Number
field.description: The identification number of the destination thruster.

field.name: Actuation Value
field.description: Actuation magnitude.

message.name: Set Fin Position
message.description: Actuate directly on a fin.

field.name: Fin Number
field.description: The identification number of the destination fin.

field.name: Desired Position
field.description: Indicates the desired fin position.

message.name: Dimmer Status
message.description: Report of the current dimmer status.

message.name: Dimmer Command
message.description: Actuate the dimmer.

message.name: Robotic Arm Status
message.description: Report of the current robotic arm status.

message.name: Set Servo Position
message.description: Set the position of a servo.

message.name: Set Control Surface Deflection
message.description: Set the deflection angle of a control surface.

message.name: Remote Actions Request
message.description: This message is used as query to request for the possible remote actions (operation=QUERY and the list is empty in this case). The vehicle responds using the same message type returning the tuplelist with the pairs: Action,Type (operation=REPORT). The type of action can be Axis, Hat or Button.

field.name: Actions
field.description: Example: "Propulsion=Axis,PanTilt=Hat,Lights=Button"

message.name: Remote Actions
message.description: This message is used to send a periodic update of values for each remote action. If the action is not on the list the assumed value is 0.

field.name: Actions
field.description: Example: "Propeler=0.6,PanTilt=0.75,Lights=1"

message.name: Home Reference Setting
message.description: Set the vehicle's home reference.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude coordinate.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude coordinate.

field.name: Depth
field.description: The value of the depth.

message.name: Navigation Startup Point
message.description: Set the vehicle's navigation start-up point. This is navigation aid, used when the vehicle cannot obtain a GPS Fix when starting a mission.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude coordinate.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude coordinate.

field.name: Depth
field.description: The value of the depth.

message.name: Estimated Stream Speed
message.description: The estimated stream speed, typically for a water or air stream.

field.name: X component (North)
field.description: X component (North).

field.name: Y component (East)
field.description: Y component (East).

field.name: Z component (Down)
field.description: Z component (Down).

message.name: Desired Guidance
message.description:
Message used to specify the desired guidance of the vehicle (heading, depth and velocity).

This constitutes the interface for maneuver controllers to interact with vehicle heading, depth and speed controllers or other types of guidance controllers.

field.name: Guidance Indicators
field.description: Defines the type of guidance performed, by stating which fields have defined information and how they should be interpreted.

bitmask.name: Heading Angle
bitmask.description: Heading field is defined and should be interpreted as the absolute heading for guidance.

bitmask.name: Velocity
bitmask.description: The 'Velocity' and 'Velocity Units' fields are defined.

bitmask.name: Waypoint
bitmask.description: All waypoint related (latitude/longitude/orbit time/orbit radius) and 'Depth' fields are defined.

field.name: Heading
field.description: The value of the desired heading angle, relative to true north, in radians or as heading turn rate.

field.name: Bank
field.description: The value of the desired bank angle.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Desired altitude or depth. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Velocity
field.description: The value of the desired velocity.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Vertical Rate
field.description: The value of the desired vertical rate.

field.name: Waypoint WGS-84 Latitude
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Waypoint WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Waypoint Orbit Time
field.description: Waypoint orbit time (for loiter control).

field.name: Waypoint Orbit Radius
field.description: Waypoint orbit radius (for loiter control).

field.name: Waypoint Orbit Direction
field.description: Waypoint orbit time (for loiter control).

message.name: Piccolo Waypoint
message.description: List of waypoints. This is sent upon update by the external device, or in request to a WaypointList message.

field.name: Waypoint Index
field.description: Waypoint identifier.

field.name: Index of Next Waypoint
field.description: Identifier of waypoint that follows the execution of this waypoint (100 if not defined).

field.name: Waypoint WGS-84 Latitude
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude.

field.name: Waypoint WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Altitude or depth. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Loiter Radius
field.description: Loitering radius. For waypoints with no loitering, this value is 0.

field.name: Loiter Time
field.description: Loiter duration, if loitering is defined for the waypoint. A value of 0 indicates indefinite loiter time.

message.name: List Piccolo Waypoints
message.description: Require list of waypoints defined for the external device.

message.name: Piccolo Waypoint Deleted
message.description: Informs that a waypoint has been deleted.

field.name: Waypoint Index
field.description: Waypoint index.

message.name: Piccolo Tracking State
message.description: Indicates the waypoint tracked by the vehicle.

field.name: Target Waypoint Identifier
field.description: Target waypoint identifier.

field.name: Source Waypoint Identifier
field.description: Optional source waypoint identifier (100 if not defined).

field.name: Loitering
field.description: Loiter flag, set if loitering.

message.name: Maneuver Command
message.description:
Interface with the maneuver control supervisor module.

Current support includes core commands for starting and stopping maneuvers. The senders of this message are typically vehicle or mission supervisor modules.

When starting a maneuver, the maneuver to execute is embedded within the maneuver field.

field.name: Command
field.description: Code indicating the control command.

enum.name: Start maneuver
enum.description: Start the maneuver as indicated by the maneuver argument. The command is ignored if there is already a maneuver running (the current maneuver must be explicitly stopped or terminate by itself before another maneuver can be started).

enum.name: Stop maneuver
enum.description: Force currently executing maneuver to stop. The command is ignored if no maneuver is executing.

field.name: Maneuver
field.description: Maneuver associated with some commands (currently only START).

message.name: Maneuver State
message.description:
Report of the current maneuver's execution state.

The reported state includes the maneuver status, current waypoint track and current target reference.

The recipients for this message are usually vehicle or mission supervisor modules. The message can also be used to monitor maneuver execution by a CCU, in particular the behaviour of reference generator controllers.

field.name: State
field.description: Code indicating maneuver state.

field.name: Start Point North Offset
field.description: North coordinate of reference starting point.

field.name: Start Point East Offset
field.description: East coordinate of reference starting point.

field.name: End Point North Offset
field.description: North coordinate of reference end point.

field.name: End Point East Offset
field.description: East coordinate of reference end point.

field.name: Desired Point North Offset
field.description: North coordinate of current desired point, typically derived with a reference generator.

field.name: Desired Point East Offset
field.description: East coordinate of current desired point, typically derived with a reference generator.

message.name: Goto Maneuver
message.description:
A "Goto" is a maneuver specifying a movement of the vehicle to a target waypoint. The waypoint is described by the WGS-84 waypoint coordinate and target depth.

Mandatory parameters defined for a "Goto" timeout, tolerance radius and velocity.

Optional parameters be defined for the target Euler Angles (pitch, yaw and roll) though these parameters may not be considered by all maneuver controllers in charge of the execution of this type of maneuver.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Target depth/altitude indicator. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Radius Tolerance
field.description: This radius tolerance indicates the minimum distance from the target waypoint to consider the maneuver successfully terminated.

field.name: Roll
field.description: The the phi Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be unconsidered. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.name: Pitch
field.description: The theta Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be disconcerted. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.name: Yaw
field.description: The psi Euler angle in which the vehicle should set its attitude. Use '-1' for this field to be considered. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2 Pi.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Dive Maneuver
message.description: The Dive maneuver is intended for underwater vehicles and makes the vehicle dive until a certain depth.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run. If the maneuver is not completed in the amount of time specified an error will be generated.

field.name: Depth (m)
field.description: The target desired depth for the maneuver.

field.name: Velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: heading
field.description: The heading to be used on the dive. Use '-1' for this field to be unconsidered. Otherwise the value spans from 0 to 2Pi.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Popup Maneuver
message.description: The Pop Up maneuver makes the vehicle come to the surface at a specific waypoint. This is used in underwater vehicles.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run. If the maneuver is not completed in the amount of time specified an error will be generated.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude.

field.name: Depth (m)
field.description: The target desired depth for the maneuver.

field.name: Duration
field.description: The duration of this maneuver at surface level. Use '0' for unlimited duration time.

field.name: Velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Radius Tolerance
field.description: This radius tolerance indicates the minimum distance from the popup waypoint to start vehicle popup.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Teleoperation Maneuver
message.description: The Teleoperation Maneuver lets the vehicle be controlled by a human operator interface, usually expressed using Joystick messages.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run. If the maneuver is not completed in the amount of time specified an error will be generated.

field.name: Maximum velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver. Use '-1' for unlimited value of the velocity.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Minimum Depth/Altitude
field.description: Minimum depth/altitude allowed for teleoperation.

field.name: Maximum Depth/Altitude
field.description: Maximum depth/altitude allowed for teleoperation.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The timeout indicates the time that an error should occur if exceeded.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude coordinate.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude coordinate.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Depth/Altitude indicator. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Duration
field.description: The duration of this maneuver. Use '0' for unlimited duration time.

field.name: Velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Idle Maneuver
message.description: Causes the vehicle to stay idle for some time.

field.name: Duration
field.description: Optional duration of the Idle maneuver. Use '0' for unlimited duration time (maneuver will have to be explicitly stopped).

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Elemental Maneuver
message.description: Elemental Maneuver: it keeps the vehicle heading and/or depth and/or velocity for a specified amount of time. The 'indicator' field specifies which parameters should be considered for the elemental maneuver. This maneuver specification is appropriate for testing vehicle sanity or low-level fine-grained vehicle control.

field.name: Parameter Indicator
field.description: Parameter indicator bitmask, specifying which actual parameters should be considered for the elemental maneuver.

field.name: Duration
field.description: Duration of the maneuver. Use '0' for unlimited duration time (maneuver will only be stopped on request or due to a high level control switch in this case).

field.name: Heading
field.description: The value of the desired heading angle, relative to true north, in radians.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Depth/Altitude indicator. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Velocity
field.description: The value of the desired velocity.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Specifies the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Target depth/altitude indicator. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Radius Tolerance
field.description: This radius tolerance indicates the minimum distance from the target waypoint to consider the maneuver successfully terminated.

field.name: Search Radius
field.description: This radius tolerance indicates the minimum distance from the target waypoint to consider the maneuver successfully terminated.

field.name: Operation Area Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Operation Area Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Rows Maneuver
message.description: Rows maneuver

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Target depth/altitude indicator. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run.

field.name: Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Longitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude of target waypoint.

field.name: Altitude or Depth
field.description: Target depth/altitude indicator. Use negative values for altitude (UAVs), positive values for depth (AUVs,ASVs,ROVs).

field.name: Velocity
field.description: Velocity to be used in this maneuver.

field.name: Velocity units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the Velocity field.

field.name: Radius Tolerance
field.description: This radius tolerance indicates the minimum distance from the target waypoint to consider the maneuver successfully terminated.

field.name: Path Points
field.description: Inline message of type PathPoint, encoding the path points.

field.name: Offset north (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the path start point.

field.name: Offset east (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the path start point.

field.name: Offset north (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down coordinate of this point in relation to the path start point.

field.name: Next Point
field.description: Inline message of type PathPoint, encoding the next path point. If not defined, this point is the last point in the path.

message.name: Custom Maneuver
message.description: The Custom Maneuver message may be used as specification of a very specific maneuver not covered by the IMC scope. The settings of the maneuver are just its id, timeout and other settings encoded as a tuple list.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: The amount of time the maneuver is allowed to run. If the maneuver is not completed in the amount of time specified an error will be generated.

field.name: Maneuver Name
field.description: The maneuver name, used as key by an implementation to bind the maneuver to the corresponding controller.

field.name: Custom settings for maneuver
field.description: Custom settings for maneuver.

message.name: Vehicle State
message.description:
The Vehicle State message is reported by the Vehicle supervisor periodically in response to a Vehicle Command message or to report an high level maneuver execution state.

The reported state may refer to idleness, an execution error, or maneuver initialization/normal execution/timeout or error.

Additional information comprises:

  • A summary of the vehicle's accumulated events is reported in the [warning|timeout|error|fatal]_events field masks. The value of each bit persists until a recovering event is detected.
  • Notification events are reported in the notification_events field mask. The information is not persistent across vehicle state reports.
  • A summary of vehicle verified conditions and executed actions is given by the
  • conditions_verified and executed_actions field.

field.name: State
field.description: The current vehicle supervisor operational state

enum.name: Idle
enum.description: The Vehicle Supervisor is on Idle state

enum.name: Initialization
enum.description: The Vehicle Supervisor is now starting

enum.name: Error
enum.description: The Vehicle Supervisor encountered an error.

enum.name: Executing Maneuver
enum.description: Vehicle Supervisor is currently executing a maneuver

enum.name: Maneuver Done
enum.description: The maneuver has been successfully completed

enum.name: Maneuver Error
enum.description: The maneuver controller returned an error

field.name: Control Mode
field.description: Active Control Mode

field.name: Monitored Event Mask
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) being monitored. Bit b is set if corresponding event source is being monitored. If an event source bit is not enabled in this mask then the corresponding status for the event source signalled in fatal/error/warning/timeout/notification_events, should be ignored.

field.name: Critical Event Mask
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) being monitored and which will prevent vehicle from operating if an error is detected. The source set is a subset of event sources specified by the event_mask field.

field.name: Boot Events
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) with boot condition status. Bit b is set if corresponding event source is in bool condition status and persists until another operation status is reported.

field.name: Fatal Events
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) with fatal condition status. Bit b is set if corresponding event source is in fatal condition status and persists until another operation status is reported.

field.name: Error Events
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) with error condition status. Bit b is set if corresponding event source is in error condition status and persists until another operation status is reported.

field.name: Timeout Events
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) with timeout condition status. Bit b is set if corresponding event source is in timeout condition status and persists until another operation status is reported.

field.name: Warning Events
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) with warning condition status. Bit b is set if corresponding event source is in warning condition status and persists until another operation status is reported.

field.name: Notification Events
field.description: Bitmask indicating event sources (see Event message) that issed notification events. Bit b is set if corresponding event source just sent a notification. The status does not persist and is indenpendent of all other status conditions.

field.name: Verified Conditions
field.description: The conditions verified. Coma separated list of conditions ids.

field.name: Executed Actions
field.description: The executed actions. Coma separated list of actions ids.

message.name: Vehicle Command
message.description:
A command sent to the vehicle supervisor.

Current support includes commands to:

  • Initialising the vehicle for autonomous maneuver execution.
  • Starting a new maneuver, after initialisation.
  • Stopping autonomous maneuver execution

field.name: Command
field.description: The type of command/action to be performed

enum.name: Execute Maneuver
enum.description: Execute the maneuver passed on field 'maneuver'

enum.name: Initialize
enum.description: Initialize the vehicle supervisor to be prepared for maneuver execution.

field.name: Transition Identifier
field.description: Transition identifier (used for commands SET_TRANSITION and REMOVE_TRANSITION)

field.name: Action List
field.description: List of actions to be executed (only used for commands SET_TRANSITION and EXEC_ACTION)

field.name: Condition List
field.description: List of conditions to be tested in the transition (command SET_TRANSITION only)

field.name: Maneuver
field.description: Maneuver to be executed (for command EXEC_MANEUVER)

message.name: Vehicle Configuration
message.description:
Reports the possible and enabled sets for conditions and actions that can be used for maneuver transitions and are supported by the vehicle supervisor.

The order of the transitions in the 'all_conditions' field, determines the bit associated with each condition in the field 'verified conditions' on message 'vehicle_status'.

field.name: All transition conditions
field.description: Comma separated list of all possible maneuver transition conditions.

field.name: Enabled transition conditions
field.description: The coma separated list of active conditions.

field.name: All transition actions
field.description: Comma separated list of all possible maneuver transition actions.

field.name: Enabled transition actions
field.description: Comma separated list of all possible maneuver transition actions.

message.name: Vehicle Action
message.description: Request action to be performed by the vehicle, other than maneuver control.

field.name: Action
field.description: Action name.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: Action timeout.

field.name: Device ID
field.description: Optional action dependent target device id, if necessary for the operation.

field.name: Argument
field.description: Optional action argument.

message.name: Request Control Mode
message.description:
Request control mode of the vehicle to be set. If request is valid, vehicle will issue a SetControlMode message internally. The control modes are:
  • None: when set, the vehicle will rest in an idle state, in particular maneuver/guidance/actuation components necessary for maneuvering will be disabled.
  • Diagnostic control: when set, the vehicle will be set up to perform diagnostic tests.
  • Manual operation: when set, the vehicle will allow tele-operation by an human operator. The necessary components for this control mode will be activated in a vehicle-dependent fashion.
  • Automatic control: when set, the vehicle will have all necessary modules for autonomous maneuver execution enabled, including maneuver/guidance/actuation components.

field.name: State
field.description: Control Mode

enum.name: None
enum.description: Request any type of control to be disabled.

message.name: Set Control Mode
message.description:
Set vehicle control mode. The control modes are:
  • None: when set, the vehicle will rest in an idle state, in particular maneuver/guidance/actuation components necessary for maneuvering will be disabled.
  • Diagnostic control: when set, the vehicle will be set up to perform diagnostic tests.
  • Manual operation: when set, the vehicle will allow tele-operation by an human operator. The necessary components for this control mode will be activated in a vehicle-dependent fashion.
  • Automatic control: when set, the vehicle will have all necessary modules for autonomous maneuver execution enabled, including maneuver/guidance/actuation components.

field.name: State
field.description: Control Mode

message.name: Mission Command
message.description:
The Mission Command message is used to control the mission execution by an autonomous vehicle.

An acknowledgement of the received messages is sent every time a message of this type is received using the Mission State message.

Mission commands include:

  • Loading a mission from a Mission Specification message or saved mission file.
  • Unloading the currently loaded mission.
  • Saving currently loaded mission to the on-board file system, so it can later be restored.
  • Starting a mission.
  • Stopping a mission.

field.name: Command
field.description: The command to be executed by the Mission Supervisor.

enum.name: Load Mission
enum.description: Load mission as specified by the 'argument' field, which must contain a MissionSpecification message.

enum.name: Load Mission from File
enum.description: Load mission from file. The 'mission_id' field is the key for the mission load (cannot be empty).

enum.name: Save Mission
enum.description: Save current mission to file. The mission can later be restored using the 'LOAD_MISSION_FROM_FILE' command.

enum.name: Unload Mission
enum.description: Unloads mission as specified by the 'argument' field, which must contain a MissionSpecification message.

enum.name: Start Mission Execution
enum.description: Start executing the given mission. The 'argument' field should contain a 'MissionSpecification' message.

field.name: Mission ID
field.description: The mission name the command relates to, if the command requires a mission name. (eg. for Load Mission command).

field.name: Maneuver ID
field.description: The maneuver the command relates to, if the command needs a maneuver name (eg. for Skip and Force commands).

field.name: Command Argument
field.description: A command argument, if the command requires one (eg. for Start Mission command).

message.name: Mission State
message.description:
Report of the mission execution state, which happens for every Mission Command request or maneuver transition. Specifically the mission state is reported when:

  • A mission is loaded/unloaded/saved.
  • A mission is started/stopped/completed.
  • A maneuver is started.

field.name: Mission state
field.description: State of the mission

enum.name: Idle State
enum.description: No mission is loaded nor executing.

field.name: Mission ID
field.description: The mission this message is related to.

field.name: Maneuver ID
field.description: The current active maneuver name. It is empty if no maneuver is active.

field.name: Description
field.description: Complementary description of state.

message.name: Mission Specification
message.description:
Identity and description of a mission's general parameters, associated with mission loading (i.e. load mission command in MissionCommand).

A mission specification is defined by a mission identifier, a set of maneuver specifications and a start maneuver from that set.

See the ManeuverSpecification message for details on maneuver specification.

field.name: Mission ID
field.description: The mission's identifier.

field.name: Mission Description
field.description: Verbose text description of mission.

field.name: Starting maneuver
field.description: Indicates the id of the starting maneuver for this mission.

field.name: Number of Maneuvers
field.description: Indicates the number of maneuvers in this mission. This counter should be equal to the number of maneuvers encoded in the maneuvers field.

field.name: Maneuvers
field.description: Maneuvers for this mission, defined by a linked list of Maneuver Specification messages.

message.name: Maneuver Specification
message.description:
Describe a maneuver in the context of a mission specification.

The maneuver specification is described by an actual concrete maneuver to execute (for example a "Goto" maneuver) plus associated transitions in the context of a mission.

See the ManeuverTransition message for details on maneuver transitions.

field.name: Maneuver ID
field.description: The maneuver name.

field.name: Maneuver Description Data
field.description: The core maneuver message (eg. Goto, Dive, etc).

field.name: Number of Transitions
field.description: Indicates the number of transitions in this mission. This counter should be equal to the number of transitions encoded in the maneuvers field.

field.name: Maneuver Transitions
field.description: The maneuver transition list. It consists of a linked list of messages of type ManeuverTransition.

field.name: Next Maneuver Specification
field.description: Specification of next maneuver in the maneuver list.

message.name: Maneuver Transition
message.description: Describes a maneuver transition within a mission specification. A transition states the vehicle conditions that must be met to signal the transition, the maneuver that should be started as a result, and an optional set of actions triggered by the transition.

field.name: Destination Maneuver Name
field.description: Target maneuver name. If it equals the special value '_done_' then mission should terminate with a success status. If it equals the special value '_error_' then the mission should terminate with an error status.

field.name: Transition conditions
field.description: Comma separated list of conditions for transition. Each condition identifier corresponds to a known predicate which is interpreted and tested internally by the vehicle.

field.name: Transition actions
field.description: Comma separated list of actions to execute upon transition, if all conditions for transition are matched. Each action identifier corresponds to a known procedure which is interpreted and executed internally by the vehicle.

field.name: Next Maneuver Transition
field.description: Specification of next transition in transition list.

message.name: Acoustic Range
message.description: Issue an acoustic range command.

field.name: Target Modem Address
field.description: Target modem address.

message.name: Acoustic Range Reply
message.description: Acoustic range measure in response to a range command.

field.name: Target Modem Address
field.description: Target modem address.

field.name: Status
field.description: Status indicating reply to range request.

field.name: Range
field.description: Range measure obtained. Usable if status indicates successful reply.

message.name: Acoustic Message
message.description: Send an acoustic message.

field.name: Message to send
field.description: Message to send

message.name: Acoustic Diagnostic
message.description: Enable/Disable Acoustic Diagnostic

field.name: Enable
field.description: Enable/Disable diagnostic

message.name: Acoustic Noise
message.description: Report on the conditions of the underwater medium, for when acoustic diagnostics are enabled.

field.name: Summary
field.description: Noise level characterization

field.name: Noise Level
field.description: Noise level value

message.name: Acoustic Ping
message.description: Ping remote modem.

message.name: Acoustic Ping Reply
message.description: Acoust Ping Reply.

message.name: LBL Set Trimmer
message.description: Set a trimmer value of the vehicle acoustics.

field.name: Trimmer
field.description: Trimmer identification

field.name: Value
field.description: Trimmer value

message.name: LBL Get Trimmer
message.description: Get a trimmer value from the vehicle acoustics.

field.name: Trimmer
field.description: Trimmer identification

message.name: Set Raw Fin Position
message.description: Actuate directly on a fin, using a raw value.

field.name: Fin Number
field.description: The identification number of the destination fin.

field.name: Value
field.description: The raw value for the fin.

message.name: Load Configuration
message.description: Load a configuration file.

field.name: Configuration File
field.description: Configuration file name.

message.name: Send SMS
message.description: Send a SMS message.

field.name: Number
field.description: Target mobile device number.

field.name: Timeout
field.description: Timeout for sending message

field.name: Contents
field.description: Message contents

message.name: CameraZoom
message.description: Camera Zoom.

field.name: Camera Number
field.description: The identification number of the destination camera.

field.name: Action
field.description: The zoom action to perform

message.name: Receive Signal Strength Information
message.description: Measure of the RSSI by a networking device. Note that the RSSI unit and range of values are device vendor-dependent and its units are arbitrary.

field.name: Device Identification
field.description: Identification of the networking device.

field.name: Value
field.description: RSSI measurement.

field.name: Device Identification
field.description: Identification of the networking device.

field.name: Value
field.description: VSWR measurement.

message.name: Logbook Entry
message.description: A piece of text that has been entered by an operator during mission execution

field.name: Operator
field.description: The operator name / identifier

field.name: Entry Text
field.description: The logbook entry text that is to be recorded

message.name: Reported State
message.description: A vehicle state that is reported to other consoles (including PDAConsole). Source can be acoustic tracker, SMS, Wi-Fi, etc...

field.name: Depth
field.description: The reported depth. In the case of not knowing the depth 0 will be reported. Airplanes usually have negative values (por positive altitude).

field.name: Roll
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Pitch
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Yaw
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Reception Time
field.note: Correct interpretation of this field may require synchronization of clocks between sender and recipient
field.description: The time when the packet was sent, as seen by the packet dispatcher. The number of seconds is represented in Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) in seconds since Jan 1, 1970 using IEEE double precision floating point numbers.

field.name: System Identifier
field.description: The id of the system whose position is being reported (it can be a vehicle's id, a boat name, etc)

field.name: Source Type
field.description: How the position was received/calculated

message.name: Remote Sensor Info
message.description: Whenever the CUCS receives a message from one of the existing sensors (through SMS, ZigBee, Acoustic Comms, ...) it disseminates that info recurring to this message.

field.name: Id
field.description: An unique string that identifies the sensor. Used mostly for logging/presentation.

field.name: Class
field.description: The class of a sensor tells the type of sensor originating this message. It will determine how the sensor is to be shown and (optionally) how the custom data (tuplelist) is to be interpreted.

message.name: Map
message.description: This message represents a simple map that is transferred between CCU consoles and (possibly) vehicles

field.name: Id
field.description: The id of the map which will can also be used for a filename

field.name: Features
field.description: A 'list' of map features (for now only MapShapes available) that are contained in this map.

message.name: MapShape
message.description: A map shape is a polygon (closed polyline) with a type.

field.name: ShapeType
field.description: A type of shape (to be used in the future) like obstacle, cement, sand, secured area, etc

field.name: Points
field.description: Points are encoded as a 'list' of messages of type MapPoint

field.name: NextShape
field.description: The next shape in the map (empty message if this is the last shape)

message.name: MapPoint
message.description: This message represents a point in the world as part of a list of other points

field.name: NextPoint
field.description: Holds the next point in this list or empty in the case of the list reaching the end

message.name: IMC Communications Test
message.description: This message is used to start and report tests for IMC communications

field.name: Test Mode
field.description: Depending on the mode, this message serves different purposes

field.name: Good Reception Count
field.description: This field is used only on the report and is ignored otherwise. Used only in TEST_REPORT mode.

field.name: Message Frequency
field.description: The number of messages to send (per second). Used only in TEST_REQUEST mode.

field.name: Payload Size
field.description: The number of bytes to be sent in the message payload. Used only in TEST_REQUEST mode.

field.name: Dummy Payload
field.description: This field is used only on the test messages and is ignored otherwise. Used only in TEST_MESSAGE mode.

message.name: PDA Console Command
message.description: Temporary message for sending commands to PDA console and debugging.

field.name: Command
field.description: Command.

field.name: Argument
field.description: Command argument.

message.name: Start Video Search
message.description: Start video search

field.name: Object Type
field.description: Type of Object to Search

message.name: Stop Video Search
message.description: Stop video search

message.name: Query Coordinates
message.description: Ask interpolator to estimate value at the given coordinates.

field.name: x
field.description: X coordinate of query

field.name: y
field.description: Y coordinate of query

field.name: z
field.description: Z coordinate of query

field.name: layer
field.description: Layer of data being interpolated. This can be used to identify several interpolators.

message.name: Query Coordinates Response
message.description: Estimated value at the given coordinates.

field.name: x
field.description: X coordinate of query

field.name: y
field.description: Y coordinate of query

field.name: z
field.description: Z coordinate of query

field.name: value
field.description: Estimated value

field.name: layer
field.description: Layer of data being interpolated. This can be used to identify several interpolators.

message.name: Query Range Coordinates
message.description: Ask interpolator to estimate value at the given coordinates.

field.name: x0
field.description: Initial X coordinate of query range

field.name: x1
field.description: End X coordinate of query range

field.name: X Resolution
field.description: Resolution on X axis

field.name: y0
field.description: Initial Y coordinate of query range

field.name: y1
field.description: End Y coordinate of query range

field.name: Y Resolution
field.description: Resolution on Y axis

field.name: layer
field.description: Layer of data being interpolated. This can be used to identify several interpolators.

message.name: Query Coordinates Range Response
message.description: Estimated value at the given coordinates.

field.name: x0
field.description: Initial X coordinate of query range

field.name: x1
field.description: End X coordinate of query range

field.name: X Resolution
field.description: Resolution on X axis

field.name: y0
field.description: Initial Y coordinate of query range

field.name: y1
field.description: End Y coordinate of query range

field.name: Y Resolution
field.description: Resolution on Y axis

field.name: layer
field.description: Layer of data being interpolated. This can be used to identify several interpolators.

field.name: value
field.description: Array of xres by yres of the estimed values over a grid defined by [Xmin-Xmax]x[Ymin-Ymax]

message.name: Report Measure
message.description: Reports a measured value, used to feed data into the interpolator.

field.name: x
field.description: X coordinate of query

field.name: y
field.description: Y coordinate of query

field.name: z
field.description: Z coordinate of query

field.name: value
field.description: Value measured

field.name: layer
field.description: Layer of data being interpolated. This can be used to identify several interpolators.
